paper.title: An Empirical Evaluation of Private Landowner Participation in Voluntary Forest Conservation Programs
paper.abstract: The use of voluntary programs targeting resource conservation on private land has become increasingly prevalent in environmental policy. Voluntary programs potentially offer significant benefits over regulatory and market-based approaches. This article examines the factors affecting landowner participation in voluntary forest conservation programs using a combination of parcel-level GIS and remotely sensed data and semi-structured interviews of landowners in Monroe County, Indiana. A logistic regression model is applied to determine the probability of participation based on landowner education, membership in other non-forest voluntary programs, dominant land use activity, parcel size, distance from urban center, land resource portfolios, and forest cover. Both land use activity and the spatial configuration of a landholder's resource portfolio are found to be statistically significant with important implications for the design and implementation of voluntary programs.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究土地所有者参与自愿森林保护计划的影响因素，涉及环境政策和资源管理，并未提及或应用于衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域。
